Posts.Content: May 13, 2009 04:38PM ameron wrote: Hi, I am starting chemo next week as well.....i am wondering why you are afraid of weight gain?  I wasn't afraid of that...I assumed I would actually lose weight from being so sick from the meds and the fact that food doesn't taste good.....wondering what you have heard about weight gain that is causing you the concern as well?  Anxious to see what those with more knowledge will say.....good luck with your decision.
Posts.Title: Confused and need Answers Please Help! Shanagirl Sukiann

Posts.Content: May 10, 2009 07:36PM ameron wrote: Hi, I'm with you on the when does it feel real issue.  I was really just diagnosed Friday.  Also feel like I am going through the motions.  But I guess, what else can you really do.  I still don't have my official diagnosis of stage/size, nodes and all that.  Meet with surgeon on Tuesday.  I'm sure I'll be having another pitty party after that and go through more shock when I get the details.  I'm 41...it would definitely be upsetting to get this diagnosis right before a wedding.  But like others said...at least you have a fiance to support you.  It's just a setback....several months of difficulty and you will be as good as new hopefully with an even better outlook on life and really appreciating what you do have.  I'm kind of thinking of this like a makeover at the moment...assuming I don't get bad news that it has spread....I'm thinking...ok after a few months of hell...i'll emerge out of this really skinny and hopefully with brand new 19 year old boobs :).  I might be way off base, but that is how I'm thinking about it....and I don't think it will be really real for me until after I've had a masectomy....or about to.  But this forum really does help.  It really helped seeing your post today...I was thinking the same thing...since its only been a few days....I wake up every morning thinking...hmmmm what to do today...and then....oh yeah...I have cancer!  How can I have something so horrible when I feel fine at the moment.  Its especially hard for those of us that have kind of sailed through life pretty easily up until this point....no physical problems....no one really close to me has been seriously ill....but I guess this is a new chapter....its pretty amazing really how quickly you can change your perception of your reality....i used to hear about this stuff and think...that couldn't happen to me because its so awful, I couldn't handle it.  But, you do handle it...you have no choice. And just appreciate what you do have!
Posts.Title: When does it feel real? PS73 Makratz

Posts.Content: May 3, 2009 03:19AM ameron wrote: MAYBE484....you said your dr. said it was worst case of fibrocystic she had ever seen....can you elaborate on the physical symptoms...are there lots of lumps...or cysts...or thickened tissue or what?  I am still hoping that I too have just a really bad case of fibro but from what I've read on fibro they are mainly smaller lumps...can be lots of them....but I have basically one breast that is just having all the tissue harden/thicken and its getting very very thick and hard....most noticeable going up my pectoral muscles because there is the least amount of fat there....its very noticeably larger in the pec area than the other ...then theres the hardening mass that continue to the middle which is harder to really see or feel because I have D cup breast anyway......ugghh this is so stressful....can't wait till thursday to get some info at my mamo appt.
Posts.Title: Breast pain ATLgigi Maybe484

Posts.Content: ameron wrote: Hi All,  Fairly new here and am waiting for a mamo /US appt tomorrow regarding a very large mass in the middle of right breast as well as hardening and thickening of tissue that is working its way up my pectoral muscle.  This waiting stuff is absolutely the worst....but what I wondering is, for those that have been diagnosed with some form or breast cancer....were there any other symptoms?  Were you tired, achey, sick alot?  Or did you feel just fine and the diagnosis was just a complete shock based on no other physical symptoms? Dx 5/7/2009, IBC, Stage IIIC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: OTHER SYMPTOMS??? ameron zuzeee

Posts.Content: ameron wrote: Hi All.....1st visit with Oncol today.  He mentioned I would be given steroid shots at each treatment for reasons that I cannot remember.  What are the side effects of that?  I've read some people gain weight because of steroids.  Are they referring to this?  What other effects do steroids have? I really don't need bloating and weight gain on top of hairloss and boob loss.  This is just so unreal.  I thought being 40 and aging was bad before.  Geesh.... I will be on Cytoxan and Adriamycin.  Because my tumor is so large, 9cm, he said I would be getting it every 2 weeks instead of the usual 3 weeks.  Any advice / warnings?  I did find one post about about those given these drugs, but more info would be appreciated.  I'm so horrified!   Dx 5/7/2009, IBC, Stage IIIC, Grade 3, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
